distribution_sources.source[:].profiles_.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate. rho_tor = sqrt(b_flux_tor/(pi*b0)) ~ sqrt(pi*r^2*b0/(pi*b0)) ~ r [m]. The toroidal field used in its definition is indicated under vacuum_toroidal_field/b0

distribution_sources.source[:].process[:.documentation: Process type. index=1 for NBI; index=2 for nuclear reaction (reaction unspecified); index=3 for nuclear reaction: T(d,n)4He [D+T->He4+n]; index=4 for nuclear reaction: He3(d,p)4He [He3+D->He4+p]; index=5 for nuclear reaction: D(d,p)T [D+D->T+p]; index=6 for nuclear reaction: D(d,n)3He [D+D->He3+n]; index=7 for runaway processes

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].gr.documentation: Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)

distribution_sources.source[:].process[:.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].gr.documentation: Set of bases for the grid subset. For each base, the structure describes the projection of the base vectors on the canonical frame of the grid.

distribution_sources.source[:].profiles_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "rho_tor"

distribution_sources.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

distribution_sources.source[:].species.i.documentation: List of elements forming the atom or molecule

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].pa.documentation: Source density of particles in phase space, for various grid subsets

distribution_sources.source[:].species.i.documentation: Quantities related to the different states of the species (ionisation, energy, excitation, ...)

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].gr.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "tensor_contravariant"

distribution_sources.source[:].markers[:.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "positions"

distribution_sources.magnetic_axis.r_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

distribution_sources.source[:].process[:.documentation: Index of the NBI beamlets group considered. Refers to the "unit/beamlets_group" array of the NBI IDS. 0 means sum over all beamlets groups.

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].gr.documentation: List of nodes forming this object (indices to objects_per_dimension(1)%object(:) in Fortran notation)

distribution_sources.source[:].species.i.documentation: String identifying ion state (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

distribution_sources.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

distribution_sources.source[:].species.documentation: Species injected or consumed by this source/sink

distribution_sources.source[:].global_qu.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "torque_tor"

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].di.documentation: List of indices of grid spaces (refers to ../grid/space) for which the source is discretely distributed. For example consider a source of 3.5 MeV alpha particles provided on a grid with two coordinates (spaces); rho_tor and energy. To specify that the source is given at energies exactly equal to 3.5 MeV, let discret have length 1 and set discrete(1)=2 since energy is dimension number 2. The source is then proportional to delta( 1 - energy / 3.5MeV ), where delta is the direct delta distribution. Discrete dimensions can only be used when the grid is rectangular.

distribution_sources.source[:].process[:.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].gr.documentation: Set of elements defining the grid subset. An element is defined by a combination of objects from potentially all spaces

distribution_sources.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

distribution_sources.source[:].profiles_.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface

distribution_sources.source[:].species.n.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

distribution_sources.source.documentation: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier")

distribution_sources.source[:].species.i.documentation: Configuration of atomic orbitals of this state, e.g. 1s2-2s1

distribution_sources.vacuum_toroidal_fie.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "b0"

distribution_sources.source[:].profiles_.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation, see time_slice/boundary/b_flux_pol_norm in the equilibrium IDS)

distribution_sources.source[:].gyro_type.documentation: Defines how to interpret the spatial coordinates: 1 = given at the actual particle birth point; 2 =given at the gyro centre of the birth point

distribution_sources.source[:].process[:.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

distribution_sources.source[:].global_qu.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "power"

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].pa.documentation: Interpolation coefficients, to be used for a high precision evaluation of the physical quantity with finite elements, provided per element in the grid subset (first dimension).

distribution_sources.source[:].profiles_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "psi"

distribution_sources.source[:].species.i.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed)

distribution_sources.ids_properties.homo.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].gr.documentation: Space dimension of the grid subset elements. This must be equal to the sum of the dimensions of the individual objects forming the element.

distribution_sources.source[:].profiles_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "rho_tor_norm"

distribution_sources.source[:].species.i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z_n"

distribution_sources.source[:].process[:.documentation: For NBI source, energy of the accelerated species considered. index = 0 for a sum over all energies; index = 1 for full energiy; index = 2 for half energy; index = 3 for third energy

distribution_sources.source[:].ggd[:].gr.documentation: List of indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object. An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on a boundary
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

distribution_sources.source[:].species.i.documentation: Maximum Z of the charge state bundle (equal to z_min if no bundle)

distribution_sources.vacuum_toroidal_fie.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

distribution_sources.ids_properties.comm.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

distribution_sources.source[:].global_qu.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "power"

distribution_sources.source[:].markers[:.documentation: Weight of the markers, i.e. number of real particles represented by each marker. The dimension of the vector correspond to the number of markers

distribution_sources.source[:].species.t.documentation: Species type. index=1 for electron; index=2 for ion species in a single/average state (refer to ion structure); index=3 for ion species in a particular state (refer to ion/state structure);  index=4 for neutral species in a single/average state (refer to neutral structure); index=5 for neutral species in a particular state (refer to neutral/state structure);  index=6 for neutron; index=7 for photon
